name: Cluster
shortDesc: Creates an Amazon Redshift cluster. A cluster is a fully managed data warehouse that consists of set of compute nodes. For more information about default values and valid values, see CreateCluster in the Amazon Redshift API Reference.

properties.name: AllowVersionUpgrade
properties.desc: When a new version of the Amazon Redshift is released, indicates whether upgrades can be applied to the engine that is running on the cluster. The upgrades are applied during the maintenance window.

properties.name: AutomatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod
properties.desc: The number of days that automated snapshots are retained. If you set the value to 0, automated snapshots are disabled.

properties.name: AvailabilityZone
properties.desc: The Amazon EC2 Availability Zone in which you want to provision your Amazon Redshift cluster. For example, if you have several Amazon EC2 instances running in a specific Availability Zone, you might want the cluster to be provisioned in the same zone in order to decrease network latency.

properties.name: ClusterParameterGroupName
properties.desc: The name of the parameter group that you want to associate with this cluster.

properties.name: ClusterSecurityGroups
properties.desc: A list of security groups that you want to associate with this cluster.

properties.name: ClusterSubnetGroupName
properties.desc: The name of a cluster subnet group that you want to associate with this cluster.

properties.name: ClusterType
properties.desc: The type of cluster. You can specify single-node or multi-node.

properties.name: ClusterVersion
properties.desc: The Amazon Redshift engine version that you want to deploy on the cluster.

properties.name: DBName
properties.desc: The name of the first database that is created when the cluster is created.

properties.name: ElasticIp
properties.desc: The Elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster.

properties.name: Encrypted
properties.desc: Indicates whether the data in the cluster is encrypted at rest.

properties.name: HsmClientCertificateIdentifier
properties.desc: Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate that the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM.

properties.name: HsmConfigurationIdentifier
properties.desc: Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the information that the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.

properties.name: KmsKeyId
properties.desc: The AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key ID that you want to use to encrypt data in the cluster.

properties.name: MasterUsername
properties.desc: The user name that is associated with the master user account for this cluster.

properties.name: MasterUserPassword
properties.desc: The password associated with the master user account for this cluster.

properties.name: NodeType
properties.desc: The node type that is provisioned for this cluster.

properties.name: NumberOfNodes
properties.desc: The number of compute nodes in the cluster. If you specify multi-node for the ClusterType parameter, you must specify a number greater than 1.

properties.name: OwnerAccount
properties.desc: When you restore from a snapshot from another AWS account, the 12-digit AWS account ID that contains that snapshot.

properties.name: Port
properties.desc: The port number on which the cluster accepts incoming connections.

properties.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
properties.desc: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which automated cluster maintenance can occur. The format of the time range is ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi.

properties.name: PubliclyAccessible
properties.desc: Indicates whether the cluster can be accessed from a public network.

properties.name: SnapshotClusterIdentifier
properties.desc: The name of the cluster the source snapshot was created from.

properties.name: SnapshotIdentifier
properties.desc: The name of the snapshot from which to create a new cluster.

properties.name: VpcSecurityGroupIds
properties.desc: A list of VPC security groups that are associated with this cluster.
